ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: See Wine/Ag evaluation or evaluation from Fall I for full comments.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: the group work
Todd Cort is a great teacher with a wealth of knowledge on this subject.
Went into good depth about how corporations consider sustainability. Good coverage of the process. Todd is a very engaging and clear lecturer.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: the explanation of oil and gas industry at the beginning
Some background information on the oil/gas industry would be helpful.

There were WAY too many in class group projects. I got far less out of those exercises than I did when Todd would just lecture. To make in class group exercises work more smoothly they need to be very focused and with a lot of assumptions already made so that we can go deeper into a single topic instead of superficially through a spectrum of topics. I got more from doing the group projects as an entire class. IT kept us more focused on the topic.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Great background on responsible business and important techniques for measurement and reporting.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It sounded cool
Sustainability measurement and reporting techniques.
To learn about corporate sustainability.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: yep!
Yes, I feel I learned a great deal in this course.
Yes. I felt I learned a practical and useful skill.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: it was great

Adv. :spread the work and go indepth with you own section. Dis. : different levels of expectations for quality and especially for the timeline of a project. All too often, people delay work and force themselves to rush. I have never understood this, and it continues to cause me frustration with the group format. Start earlier, and you wont have to drive yourself crazy at the end of the deadline. It seems so simple.
Assigned groups were much less successful than groups we were able to choose.
There were very few advantages to working in groups. Assignments would have been much better done independently, or collaboratively. However, the assignments are too long to do on our own.
Group work was great chance to meet other students and discuss subject.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It's a great class!
Definitely recommend taking this course, be prepared for lots of group work and class discussions.
